intro: Ligustrum lucidum var. alivonii, commonly known as the silver ligustrum, is a variety of the common privet shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, glossy, dark green foliage that has a silvery sheen on the underside. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by dark blue berries that are edible for birds. It is often used as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its compact growth habit and year-round aesthetic appeal. This variety is also valued for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
